item.title: Hello again for those that remember me
item.author: invalid@example.com (MotionMan)
item.dc:creator: MotionMan
item.content:encoded:
Decided to try and find what all my old UT Excessive pals where up to.
All My NRG, CFH peeps. And all the other people I enjoyed playing UT EO with. Hope everyone is well.
You can email me if you want to say hi, If I miss a reply to this thread. acumental@gmail.com

In order to facilitate UT4 EO/Surge testing and general UT4 frag nights, I'm collecting a list of Epic Games usernames for you all to connect with. Let me know if I've missed you and you'd like me to add you.

item.title: If.... what do you think?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Rip)
item.dc:creator: Rip
item.content:encoded:
Before I go too deep down the rabbit hole with this, I wanted to collect a few opinions. I'm possibly working on something for UT4. It might be my take on EO. I could be tentatively calling it 'Surge.' It would be more toned down than EO has been, but still a big boost to how UT4 weapons feel, don't get me wrong. Think the level of my take on ADR, reduced maybe a little more. And I'm thinking of leaving the health at 100, simply for comparability with other stuff - I always felt it a shame...

If.... what do you think?

item.title: I'm back and I want to play EO. When's the next game?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Jackal)
item.dc:creator: Jackal
item.content:encoded:
I never really left I suppose. But I hardly check the forums much anymore. I am happy to see that EO is a thing? Or at least, I hope it is.

I'd be interested to play some EO this weekend if anyone wants to.

Friend me if you want JackalBuF

item.title: UT4 AkEO Framework
item.author: invalid@example.com (MÆST)
item.dc:creator: MÆST
item.content:encoded:
Akimbo Excessive Overkill or "AkEO"

Unless otherwise mentioned, the game mechanics should be assumed to be based on Excessive Overkill for UT99. The main divergence is the dual wielding of two unique weapon classes.

Currently, UT4 has 11 weapons with two firing modes each. The Ripper (not counted in the 11) exists as a community prototype but probably won't make it into the game. I think it's important for an EO-type gametype to keep the vanilla UT weapons and make them excessive without...

UT4 AkEO Framework

item.title: UT4 Friday Fragfest 10/16/2015
item.author: invalid@example.com (MÆST)
item.dc:creator: MÆST
item.content:encoded:
So who is around today and will be available for some UT4 CTF action?

@Dagger, I'm curious have you started to get into the weeds on coding anything EO-related for UT4? Definitely don't want to get too far ahead of the UT4 programmers, but I would think the basic framework could be started.

A simple pure port of UT99 EO would be a place to start, but I expect there might be interest on the player and developer side of a more experimental fork. The successful experiments...

UT4 Friday Fragfest 10/16/2015

item.author: invalid@example.com (MÆST)
item.dc:creator: MÆST
item.content:encoded:
(check 0:35 seconds for a rocket jump move)

WHAT:
A scheduled UT4 CTF bloodbath open to anyone. Teams will be kept balanced and the event will run until the last man standing. Use this thread to suggest future dates/times and discuss the matches.

WHEN:
Friday 10/02 @ 9pm EST / 6pm PST

WHERE:
Epic Games USA [Central] Hub 01
*Join an active public CTF game and someone can host and invite others to a new game if the server gets full*

Google Calendar

UT4 Friday

item.title: Thursday something or other
item.author: invalid@example.com (MÆST)
item.dc:creator: MÆST
item.content:encoded:
I'm not going to be around this Friday, and so while you are more than welcome to get something going on Friday, I'm wondering if anyone is available tonight.

I also would like to try and get everyone in a vanilla UT4 CTF server some time. All the CTF maps are currently shells so they don't take much of a computer to run at high FPS.

Is there interest for both games, or just one tonight? Times?

item.title: Murder Monday
item.author: invalid@example.com (Rip)
item.dc:creator: Rip
item.content:encoded:
This Monday I challenge you All! I will be excepting challengers for my title of Fragger #1! Don't believe I deserve the title? Take it if you can! Until that moment, you are all beneath me! Lick my boots, scum. How does your brain taste?

The arena will be a custom one I have been working on! Trans + random weapon spawn! Does the wee little noob want a different weapon? Pry it from the cold dead hands of your enemy, or have yours taken instead!

Soon, I will make an...

Murder Monday

All right, so I've wiped the slate clean and started over with my server. Please take note of the new IP address and pass it around. As of this posting, I have not gotten everything back on it yet, and I intend to bring...

Rip's Excessive Server

item.title: CTF4!
item.author: invalid@example.com (Rip)
item.dc:creator: Rip
item.content:encoded:
New gametype to play with! I must say it works awesome with EO. Honestly, I might like to see it replace main CTF as my default gametype..... well, too early for that, I suppose.

Right now I have it heavily populated with bots so you can get the full experience. Eventually, I'll add some way for players to choose whether or not to have bots, but for now I've given several people the admin password and they can add or remove the bots.

I think this will be a fun mode even 1v1, in fact I find...

CTF4!

item.title: Halls of War / Daggers Development Pit
item.author: invalid@example.com (Dagger)
item.dc:creator: Dagger
item.content:encoded:
Playing UT99 ADR/EO is great fun, and helps remind us of the glory days of Excessive Overkill.

If we are to bring that excitement forward into the modern era, we will need some place to start.

I am reopening the Halls of War and Dagger's Development Pit as a single UT4 server.

At the moment it is running vanilla DM server, but as usual, expect test code to be dropped there randomly.

Daggers Development Pit and the Halls of War
UT4 IP: 173.162.16.46 port 7777

View attachment 103435

item.title: Maps by Sparky
item.author: invalid@example.com (xts-sparky)
item.dc:creator: xts-sparky
item.content:encoded:
Over the last few days I've been tinkering with UEd and came away with 2 CTF4 maps and a CTF map that I tweaked 12 or so years ago (fixed a few things this time).

CTF-LIGHTS_ON - The layout of this map reminds me of LIGHTS_OUT but it's bigger and not dark. I don't remember the original map but I didn't change much of anything regarding the architecture. Tweaked the kickers and created the CTF scoreboard....

Maps by Sparky
